did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: George W. Walker Family Papers, 1906-1910, 1934, n.d.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the George W. Walker Family Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: George W. Walker Family Papers, Ms2011-061, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to Special Collections.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the George W. Walker Family Papers was completed in June 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George W. Walker was born in Virginia in 1843. In 1872, he married Emma Wysor. They had at least eleven children. He taught for 23 years at public and private schools in Pulaski County, Va, and taught for 12 years at V.P.I. Walker died in North Carolina in 1910.

J. Ernest Walker was born in Virginia in 1873. He was an older son of George W. Walker who moved to Arizona at 11 and became successful in the real estate business. Col. John E. Walker was a young son of George W. Walker and graduated from V.P.I. with a B.S. in 1934.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a photocopy of a letter from J. Ernest Walker to his father, Professor George W. Walker regarding his experiences in the 1906 San Francisco earthquake and fire, as well as a copy of a newspaper clipping about J. Ernest Walker's real estate business. The collection also includes a photocopy of an image of Col. John E. Walker and photograph and obituary of George W. Walker.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in chronological order, with undated items at the end.
